page.title: 08WATKINS CORNER.PURTON STOKE
page.content: Mr Stephen Rodway,a salt merchant of Cricklade, was returning home from Wootton Bassett on 7th May 1819.At about 9.30 pm he was waylaid and shot and then robbed. Robert Turner Watkins and his brother Edward were charged with the murder.It was proved that Watkins had sent his ladyfriend a Â£5 note which was marked and could be identified by Rodway's son_in_law. Robert was found guilty.He was taken as near as possible to the place where the murder was,where he would be hung. So scaffolding and gallows had been erected.A large crowd of men,women and children, estimated between 5_15000, had collected to witness the execution. Then a violent thunderstorm broke and lasted for half an hour, after which the crowd dispersed quietly, and there Robert Watkins's body hung to rot.
